DataElement.preferredName: Tooth Lesion Dentin Enamel Conjunction Relationship Physical Examination Indicator
DataElement.preferredDefinition: an event, entity or condition that typically characterizes a prescribed assessment of association between the abnormal tissue in tooth with the area connecting the hard portion of the tooth surround the pulp and the hard, thin, translucent layer of calcified substance that envelops the crown of the tooth.

DataElementConcept.preferredName: Tooth Lesion Dentin Enamel Conjunction Relationship Physical Examination
DataElementConcept.preferredDefinition: informaton related to assessment of association between the abnormal tissue in tooth with the area connecting the hard portion of the tooth surround the pulp and the hard, thin, translucent layer of calcified substance that envelops the crown of the tooth.

ObjectClass.preferredDefinition: is an organ, the organ parts of which primarily consist of dentine and dental enamel; together with other teeth it constitutes a subdivision of the facial skeleton. Example(s): incisor, molar.:(LEE-zhun) An area of abnormal tissue change.

Concepts.definition: The hard bonelike structures in the jaws of vertebrates; primarily used for eating.
A localized pathological or traumatic structural change, damage, deformity, or discontinuity of tissue, organ, or body part.

Property.preferredName: Dentin Enamel Conjunction Relationship Physical Examination
Property.preferredDefinition: The hard portion of the tooth surrounding the pulp, covered by enamel on the crown and cementum on the root. Dentin is harder and denser than bone but softer than enamel.:A hard, thin, translucent layer of calcified substance that envelops and protects the dentin of the crown of the tooth. It is the hardest substance in the body and is almost entirely composed of calcium salts.:Something that joins or connects; the state of being joined together.:Related; connected or associated.:A physical examination is a systemic evaluation of the body and its functions using visual inspection, palpation, percussion, and auscultation, aimed to determine the presence or absence of physical signs of disease or abnormality for individual's health assessment.

Concepts.definition: The hard portion of the tooth surrounding the pulp, covered by enamel on the crown and cementum on the root. Dentin is harder and denser than bone but softer than enamel.

A hard, thin, translucent layer of calcified substance that envelops and protects the dentin of the crown of the tooth. It is the hardest substance in the body and is almost entirely composed of calcium salts.
Something that joins or connects; the state of being joined together.
A state of connectedness between people, objects, or events; to be associated or connected with something.

A systemic evaluation of the body and its functions using visual inspection, palpation, percussion and auscultation. The purpose is to determine the presence or absence of physical signs of disease or abnormality for an individual's health assessment.

ConceptualDomain.preferredDefinition: evaluations of the patient and the patient's disease.

DataElementConcept.origin: PEARL CRF:Practitioners Engaged in Applied Research and Learning Network Case Report Form

RepresentationTerm.preferredDefinition: An event, entity or condition that typically characterizes a prescribed environment or situation. Indicators determine or aid in determining whether or not certain stated circumstances exist or criteria are satisfied. (On-line Medical Dictionary)

Concepts.definition: An event, entity or condition that typically characterizes a prescribed environment or situation and determines or aids in determining whether certain stated circumstances exist or criteria are satisfied.

ReferenceDocuments.name: CRF Text1
ReferenceDocuments.description: Is/Are the radiographic depth(s) of the lesion(s), when visible, less than or equal to half the Dento-Enamel Junction (DEJ) to the pulp
